data.description: About Marvell Marvell’s semiconductor solutions are the essential building blocks of the data infrastructure that connects our world. Across enterprise, cloud and AI, and carrier architectures, our innovative technology is enabling new possibilities. At Marvell, you can affect the arc of individual lives, lift the trajectory of entire industries, and fuel the transformative potential of tomorrow. For those looking to make their mark on purposeful and enduring innovation, above and beyond fleeting trends, Marvell is a place to thrive, learn, and lead. Your Team, Your ImpactJoin the CE-AMS Design Flow group at Marvell, where you'll contribute to cutting-edge methodology development for AMS SerDes IPs and analog IP design. Our team designs and maintains the platform and methodology infrastructure for AMS IP design flow, focusing on automation, tooling, and systems that enable our innovative configuration-driven approach.This internship offers hands-on experience with advanced design automation, AI-powered workflows, and the opportunity to work alongside experienced engineers on real-world projects that impact our next-generation products.What You Can ExpectDevelop Design Flow Software: Create and enhance software tools for IP design automation workflowsScript Development & Maintenance: Write robust, maintainable scripts using Perl, Python, and Makefiles to streamline design processesCross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with design engineers, methodology teams, and verification groups to deliver integrated solutionsLinux Environment Development: Leverage Linux-based tools and environments to build efficient automation systemsAI-Powered Automation: Explore and implement advanced technologies including AI Agents and Skills to automate complex multi-platform workflowsDocumentation & Testing: Document your work clearly and ensure code quality through testing and peer reviewsWhat We're Looking ForCurrently pursuing a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical fieldProficiency in scripting languages: Strong experience with Python and/or PerlBuild system knowledge: Hands-on experience with Makefiles and build automationFrontend development skills: Familiarity with JavaScript and modern web technologiesProblem-solving mindset: Demonstrated ability to tackle complex technical challenges with creative solutionsTeam collaboration: Proven ability to work effectively in collaborative, cross-functional team environmentsCommunication skills: Excellent written and verbal communication abilitiesPreferred QualificationsExperience with Linux/Unix command-line tools and shell scriptingFamiliarity with version control systems (Git, SVN)Knowledge of EDA tools or semiconductor design flowsInterest in AI/ML applications for design automationPrevious internship or project experience in software developmentExpected Base Pay Range (USD)31 - 61, $ per hour.The successful candidate’s starting base pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location and market conditions. The expected base pay range for this role may be modified based on market conditions.Additional Compensation and Benefit Elements Marvell is committed to providing exceptional, comprehensive benefits that support our employees at every stage - from internship to retirement and through life’s most important moments. Our offerings are built around four key pillars: financial well-being, family support, mental and physical health, and recognition. Highlights for our interns: medical, dental, and vision coverage, perks and discounts, robust mental health resources to prioritize emotional well-being, and paid holidays. Additional compensation may be available for intern PhD candidates. We look forward to sharing more with you during the interview process.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.Any applicant who requires a reasonable accommodation during the selection process should contact Marvell HR Helpdesk at TAOps@marvell.com.Interview Integrity To support fair and authentic hiring practices, candidates are not permitted to use AI tools (such as transcription apps, real-time answer generators like ChatGPT or Copilot, or automated note-taking bots) during interviews.These tools must not be used to record, assist with, or enhance responses in any way. Our interviews are designed to evaluate your individual experience, thought process, and communication skills in real time. Use of AI tools without prior instruction from the interviewer will result in disqualification from the hiring process.This position may require access to technology and/or software subject to U.S. export control laws and regulations, including the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). As such, applicants must be eligible to access export-controlled information as defined under applicable law. Marvell may be required to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce and/or the U.S. Department of State. Except for U.S. citizens, lawful permanent residents, or protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), all applicants may be subject to an export license review process prior to employment.#LI-RM1
requirements: Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field
responsibilities: Develop Design Flow Software: Create and enhance software tools for IP design automation workflows
Script Development & Maintenance: Write robust, maintainable scripts using Perl, Python, and Makefiles to streamline design processes
Linux Environment Development: Leverage Linux-based tools and environments to build efficient automation systems
Frontend development skills: Familiarity with JavaScript and modern web technologies
Previous internship or project experience in software development
